schema.name: firmware
schema.help: Retrieve a list of firmware images available to use for upgrade on this device.

schema.name: firmware
schema.help: Perform firmware upgrade with local firmware file.

options.name: usb
options.help: upload from usb drive (not implemented/supportted yet).

options.name: fortiguard
options.help: download from FortiGuard services (not implemented/supportted yet).

filename.name: filename
filename.help: Name and path of the local firmware file.

format_partition.name: format_partition
format_partition.help: Set to true to format boot partition before upgrade.

file_content.name: file_content
file_content.help: Provided when uploading a file: base64 encoded file data. Must not contain whitespace or other invalid base64 characters. Must be included in HTTP body.

schema.name: ha-checksums
schema.help: List of checksums for members of HA cluster.

gui-ipv6.name: gui-ipv6
gui-ipv6.help: Enable/disable IPv6 settings on the GUI.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not display the feature in GUI.

gui-certificates.name: gui-certificates
gui-certificates.help: Enable/disable the System > Certificate GUI page, allowing you to add and configure certificates from the GUI.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not display the feature in GUI.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not display the feature in GUI.

gui-wireless-opensecurity.name: gui-wireless-opensecurity
gui-wireless-opensecurity.help: Enable/disable wireless open security option on the GUI.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not display the feature in GUI.

gui-display-hostname.name: gui-display-hostname
gui-display-hostname.help: Enable/disable displaying the FortiGate's hostname on the GUI login page.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not display the feature in GUI.

gui-lines-per-page.name: gui-lines-per-page
gui-lines-per-page.help: Number of lines to display per page for web administration.

admin-https-ssl-versions.name: admin-https-ssl-versions
admin-https-ssl-versions.help: Allowed TLS versions for web administration.

admintimeout.name: admintimeout
admintimeout.help: Number of minutes before an idle administrator session times out (5 - 480 minutes (8 hours), default = 5). A shorter idle timeout is more secure.

admin-console-timeout.name: admin-console-timeout
admin-console-timeout.help: Console login timeout that overrides the admintimeout value. (15 - 300 seconds) (15 seconds to 5 minutes). 0 the default, disables this timeout.

admin-concurrent.name: admin-concurrent
admin-concurrent.help: Enable/disable concurrent administrator logins. (Use policy-auth-concurrent for firewall authenticated users.)

admin-lockout-threshold.name: admin-lockout-threshold
admin-lockout-threshold.help: Number of failed login attempts before an administrator account is locked out for the admin-lockout-duration.

admin-lockout-duration.name: admin-lockout-duration
admin-lockout-duration.help: Amount of time in seconds that an administrator account is locked out after reaching the admin-lockout-threshold for repeated failed login attempts.

daily-restart.name: daily-restart
daily-restart.help: Enable/disable daily restart of FortiGate unit. Use the restart-time option to set the time of day for the restart.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable daily reboot of the FortiGate.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable daily reboot of the FortiGate.

admin-login-max.name: admin-login-max
admin-login-max.help: Maximum number of administrators who can be logged in at the same time (1 - 100, default = 100)

remoteauthtimeout.name: remoteauthtimeout
remoteauthtimeout.help: Number of seconds that the FortiGate waits for responses from remote RADIUS, LDAP, or TACACS+ authentication servers. (0-300 sec, default = 5, 0 means no timeout).

ldapconntimeout.name: ldapconntimeout
ldapconntimeout.help: Global timeout for connections with remote LDAP servers in milliseconds (0 - 4294967295, default 500).

batch-cmdb.name: batch-cmdb
batch-cmdb.help: Enable/disable batch mode, allowing you to enter a series of CLI commands that will execute as a group once they are loaded.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable batch mode to execute in CMDB server.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable batch mode to execute in CMDB server.

multi-factor-authentication.name: multi-factor-authentication
multi-factor-authentication.help: Enforce all login methods to require an additional authentication factor (default = optional).

options.name: optional
options.help: Do not enforce all login methods to require an additional authentication factor (controlled by user settings).

options.name: mandatory
options.help: Enforce all login methods to require an additional authentication factor.

ssl-min-proto-version.name: ssl-min-proto-version
ssl-min-proto-version.help: Minimum supported protocol version for SSL/TLS connections (default = TLSv1.2).

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.help: Number corresponding to your time zone from 00 to 86. Enter set timezone ? to view the list of time zones and the numbers that represent them.

options.help: (GMT+1:00) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna

traffic-priority.name: traffic-priority
traffic-priority.help: Choose Type of Service (ToS) or Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) for traffic prioritization in traffic shaping.

traffic-priority-level.name: traffic-priority-level
traffic-priority-level.help: Default system-wide level of priority for traffic prioritization.

anti-replay.name: anti-replay
anti-replay.help: Level of checking for packet replay and TCP sequence checking.

send-pmtu-icmp.name: send-pmtu-icmp
send-pmtu-icmp.help: Enable/disable sending of path maximum transmission unit (PMTU) - ICMP destination unreachable packet and to support PMTUD protocol on your network to reduce fragmentation of packets.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable sending of PMTU ICMP destination unreachable packet.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable sending of PMTU ICMP destination unreachable packet.

revision-image-auto-backup.name: revision-image-auto-backup
revision-image-auto-backup.help: Enable/disable back-up of the latest configuration revision after the firmware is upgraded.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable revision image backup automatically when upgrading image.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable revision image backup automatically when upgrading image.

revision-backup-on-logout.name: revision-backup-on-logout
revision-backup-on-logout.help: Enable/disable back-up of the latest configuration revision when an administrator logs out of the CLI or GUI.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable revision config backup automatically when logout.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable revision config backup automatically when logout.

hostname.name: hostname
hostname.help: FortiGate unit's hostname. Most models will truncate names longer than 24 characters. Some models support hostnames up to 35 characters.

strong-crypto.name: strong-crypto
strong-crypto.help: Enable to use strong encryption and only allow strong ciphers (AES, 3DES) and digest (SHA1) for HTTPS/SSH/TLS/SSL functions.

ssh-cbc-cipher.name: ssh-cbc-cipher
ssh-cbc-cipher.help: Enable/disable CBC cipher for SSH access.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable CBC cipher for SSH access.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable CBC cipher for SSH access.

ssh-kex-sha1.name: ssh-kex-sha1
ssh-kex-sha1.help: Enable/disable SHA1 key exchange for SSH access.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable SHA1 for SSH key exchanges.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable SHA1 for SSH key exchanges.

ssl-static-key-ciphers.name: ssl-static-key-ciphers
ssl-static-key-ciphers.help: Enable/disable static key ciphers in SSL/TLS connections (e.g. AES128-SHA, AES256-SHA, AES128-SHA256, AES256-SHA256).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable static key ciphers in SSL/TLS connections.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable static key ciphers in SSL/TLS connections.

snat-route-change.name: snat-route-change
snat-route-change.help: Enable/disable the ability to change the static NAT route.

dh-params.name: dh-params
dh-params.help: Number of bits to use in the Diffie-Hellman exchange for HTTPS/SSH protocols.

fds-statistics.name: fds-statistics
fds-statistics.help: Enable/disable sending IPS, Application Control, and AntiVirus data to FortiGuard. This data is used to improve FortiGuard services and is not shared with external parties and is protected by Fortinet's privacy policy.

fds-statistics-period.name: fds-statistics-period
fds-statistics-period.help: FortiGuard statistics collection period in minutes. (1 - 1440 min (1 min to 24 hours), default = 60).

mc-ttl-notchange.name: mc-ttl-notchange
mc-ttl-notchange.help: Enable/disable no modification of multicast TTL.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable no modification of multicast TTL.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable no modification of multicast TTL.

tcp-option.name: tcp-option
tcp-option.help: Enable SACK, timestamp and MSS TCP options.

lldp-transmission.name: lldp-transmission
lldp-transmission.help: Enable/disable Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) transmission.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable transmission of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP).

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable transmission of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP).

proxy-auth-timeout.name: proxy-auth-timeout
proxy-auth-timeout.help: Authentication timeout in minutes for authenticated users (1 - 3600 sec, default = 300).

proxy-re-authentication-mode.name: proxy-re-authentication-mode
proxy-re-authentication-mode.help: Control if users must re-authenticate after a session is closed, traffic has been idle, or from the point at which the user was first created.

options.name: session
options.help: Proxy re-authentication timeout begins at the closure of the session.

options.name: traffic
options.help: Proxy re-authentication timeout begins after traffic has not been received.

options.name: absolute
options.help: Proxy re-authentication timeout begins when the user was first created.

proxy-auth-lifetime.name: proxy-auth-lifetime
proxy-auth-lifetime.help: Enable/disable authenticated users lifetime control.  This is a cap on the total time a proxy user can be authenticated for after which re-authentication will take place.

proxy-auth-lifetime-timeout.name: proxy-auth-lifetime-timeout
proxy-auth-lifetime-timeout.help: Lifetime timeout in minutes for authenticated users (5  - 65535 min, default=480 (8 hours)).

sys-perf-log-interval.name: sys-perf-log-interval
sys-perf-log-interval.help: Time in minutes between updates of performance statistics logging. (1 - 15 min, default = 5, 0 = disabled).

check-protocol-header.name: check-protocol-header
check-protocol-header.help: Level of checking performed on protocol headers. Strict checking is more thorough but may affect performance. Loose checking is ok in most cases.

vip-arp-range.name: vip-arp-range
vip-arp-range.help: Controls the number of ARPs that the FortiGate sends for a Virtual IP (VIP) address range.

options.name: unlimited
options.help: Send ARPs for all addresses in VIP range.

options.name: restricted
options.help: Send ARPs for the first 8192 addresses in VIP range.

reset-sessionless-tcp.name: reset-sessionless-tcp
reset-sessionless-tcp.help: Action to perform if the FortiGate receives a TCP packet but cannot find a corresponding session in its session table. NAT/Route mode only.

allow-traffic-redirect.name: allow-traffic-redirect
allow-traffic-redirect.help: Disable to allow traffic to be routed back on a different interface.

strict-dirty-session-check.name: strict-dirty-session-check
strict-dirty-session-check.help: Enable to check the session against the original policy when revalidating. This can prevent dropping of redirected sessions when web-filtering and authentication are enabled together. If this option is enabled, the FortiGate unit deletes a session if a routing or policy change causes the session to no longer match the policy that originally allowed the session.

tcp-halfclose-timer.name: tcp-halfclose-timer
tcp-halfclose-timer.help: Number of seconds the FortiGate unit should wait to close a session after one peer has sent a FIN packet but the other has not responded (1 - 86400 sec (1 day), default = 120).

tcp-halfopen-timer.name: tcp-halfopen-timer
tcp-halfopen-timer.help: Number of seconds the FortiGate unit should wait to close a session after one peer has sent an open session packet but the other has not responded (1 - 86400 sec (1 day), default = 10).

tcp-timewait-timer.name: tcp-timewait-timer
tcp-timewait-timer.help: Length of the TCP TIME-WAIT state in seconds.

udp-idle-timer.name: udp-idle-timer
udp-idle-timer.help: UDP connection session timeout. This command can be useful in managing CPU and memory resources (1 - 86400 seconds (1 day), default = 60).

block-session-timer.name: block-session-timer
block-session-timer.help: Duration in seconds for blocked sessions (1 - 300 sec  (5 minutes), default = 30).

ip-src-port-range.name: ip-src-port-range
ip-src-port-range.help: IP source port range used for traffic originating from the FortiGate unit.

pre-login-banner.name: pre-login-banner
pre-login-banner.help: Enable/disable displaying the administrator access disclaimer message on the login page before an administrator logs in.

post-login-banner.name: post-login-banner
post-login-banner.help: Enable/disable displaying the administrator access disclaimer message after an administrator successfully logs in.

av-failopen.name: av-failopen
av-failopen.help: Set the action to take if the FortiGate is running low on memory or the proxy connection limit has been reached.

options.name: pass
options.help: Bypass the antivirus system when memory is low. Antivirus scanning resumes when the low memory condition is resolved.

options.name: off
options.help: Stop accepting new AV sessions when entering conserve mode, but continue to process current active sessions.

options.name: one-shot
options.help: Bypass the antivirus system when memory is low.

av-failopen-session.name: av-failopen-session
av-failopen-session.help: When enabled and a proxy for a protocol runs out of room in its session table, that protocol goes into failopen mode and enacts the action specified by av-failopen.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable AV fail open session option.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable AV fail open session option.

memory-use-threshold-extreme.name: memory-use-threshold-extreme
memory-use-threshold-extreme.help: Threshold at which memory usage is considered extreme (new sessions are dropped) (% of total RAM, default = 95).

memory-use-threshold-red.name: memory-use-threshold-red
memory-use-threshold-red.help: Threshold at which memory usage forces the FortiGate to enter conserve mode (% of total RAM, default = 88).

memory-use-threshold-green.name: memory-use-threshold-green
memory-use-threshold-green.help: Threshold at which memory usage forces the FortiGate to exit conserve mode (% of total RAM, default = 82).

cpu-use-threshold.name: cpu-use-threshold
cpu-use-threshold.help: Threshold at which CPU usage is reported. (% of total CPU, default = 90).

check-reset-range.name: check-reset-range
check-reset-range.help: Configure ICMP error message verification. You can either apply strict RST range checking or disable it.

vdom-admin.name: vdom-admin
vdom-admin.help: Enable/disable support for multiple virtual domains (VDOMs).

admin-port.name: admin-port
admin-port.help: Administrative access port for HTTP. (1 - 65535, default = 80).

admin-sport.name: admin-sport
admin-sport.help: Administrative access port for HTTPS. (1 - 65535, default = 443).

admin-https-redirect.name: admin-https-redirect
admin-https-redirect.help: Enable/disable redirection of HTTP administration access to HTTPS.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable redirecting HTTP administration access to HTTPS.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable redirecting HTTP administration access to HTTPS.

admin-ssh-password.name: admin-ssh-password
admin-ssh-password.help: Enable/disable password authentication for SSH admin access.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable password authentication for SSH admin access.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable password authentication for SSH admin access.

admin-restrict-local.name: admin-restrict-local
admin-restrict-local.help: Enable/disable local admin authentication restriction when remote authenticator is up and running. (default = disable)

admin-ssh-port.name: admin-ssh-port
admin-ssh-port.help: Administrative access port for SSH. (1 - 65535, default = 22).

admin-ssh-grace-time.name: admin-ssh-grace-time
admin-ssh-grace-time.help: Maximum time in seconds permitted between making an SSH connection to the FortiGate unit and authenticating (10 - 3600 sec (1 hour), default 120).

admin-telnet-port.name: admin-telnet-port
admin-telnet-port.help: Administrative access port for TELNET. (1 - 65535, default = 23).

admin-maintainer.name: admin-maintainer
admin-maintainer.help: Enable/disable maintainer administrator login. When enabled, the maintainer account can be used to log in from the console after a hard reboot. The password is "bcpb" followed by the FortiGate unit serial number. You have limited time to complete this login.

admin-server-cert.name: admin-server-cert
admin-server-cert.help: Server certificate that the FortiGate uses for HTTPS administrative connections.

user-server-cert.name: user-server-cert
user-server-cert.help: Certificate to use for https user authentication.

admin-https-pki-required.name: admin-https-pki-required
admin-https-pki-required.help: Enable/disable admin login method. Enable to force administrators to provide a valid certificate to log in if PKI is enabled. Disable to allow administrators to log in with a certificate or password.

options.name: enable
options.help: Admin users must provide a valid certificate when PKI is enabled for HTTPS admin access.

options.name: disable
options.help: Admin users can login by providing a valid certificate or password.

wifi-certificate.name: wifi-certificate
wifi-certificate.help: Certificate to use for WiFi authentication.

wifi-ca-certificate.name: wifi-ca-certificate
wifi-ca-certificate.help: CA certificate that verifies the WiFi certificate.

auth-keepalive.name: auth-keepalive
auth-keepalive.help: Enable to prevent user authentication sessions from timing out when idle.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable use of keep alive to extend authentication.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable use of keep alive to extend authentication.

policy-auth-concurrent.name: policy-auth-concurrent
policy-auth-concurrent.help: Number of concurrent firewall use logins from the same user (1 - 100, default = 0 means no limit).

auth-session-limit.name: auth-session-limit
auth-session-limit.help: Action to take when the number of allowed user authenticated sessions is reached.

options.name: logout-inactive
options.help: Logout the most inactive user authenticated sessions.

auth-cert.name: auth-cert
auth-cert.help: Server certificate that the FortiGate uses for HTTPS firewall authentication connections.

clt-cert-req.name: clt-cert-req
clt-cert-req.help: Enable/disable requiring administrators to have a client certificate to log into the GUI using HTTPS.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable require client certificate for GUI login.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable require client certificate for GUI login.

fortiservice-port.name: fortiservice-port
fortiservice-port.help: FortiService port (1 - 65535, default = 8013). Used by FortiClient endpoint compliance. Older versions of FortiClient used a different port.

endpoint-control-fds-access.name: endpoint-control-fds-access
endpoint-control-fds-access.help: Enable/disable access to the FortiGuard network for non-compliant endpoints.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable access to FortiGuard servers for non-compliant endpoints.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable access to FortiGuard servers for non-compliant endpoints.

tp-mc-skip-policy.name: tp-mc-skip-policy
tp-mc-skip-policy.help: Enable/disable skip policy check and allow multicast through.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable skip policy check and allow multicast through.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable skip policy check and allow multicast through.

cfg-save.name: cfg-save
cfg-save.help: Configuration file save mode for CLI changes.

options.name: revert
options.help: Manually save config and revert the config when timeout.

cfg-revert-timeout.name: cfg-revert-timeout
cfg-revert-timeout.help: Time-out for reverting to the last saved configuration.

reboot-upon-config-restore.name: reboot-upon-config-restore
reboot-upon-config-restore.help: Enable/disable reboot of system upon restoring configuration.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable reboot of system upon restoring configuration.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable reboot of system upon restoring configuration.

admin-scp.name: admin-scp
admin-scp.help: Enable/disable using SCP to download the system configuration. You can use SCP as an alternative method for backing up the configuration.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable allow system configuration download by SCP.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable allow system configuration download by SCP.

security-rating-result-submission.name: security-rating-result-submission
security-rating-result-submission.help: Enable/disable the submission of Security Rating results to FortiGuard.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable submission of Security Rating results to FortiGuard.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable submission of Security Rating results to FortiGuard.

security-rating-run-on-schedule.name: security-rating-run-on-schedule
security-rating-run-on-schedule.help: Enable/disable scheduled runs of Security Rating.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable scheduled runs of Security Rating.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable scheduled runs of Security Rating.

wireless-controller.name: wireless-controller
wireless-controller.help: Enable/disable the wireless controller feature to use the FortiGate unit to manage FortiAPs.

wireless-controller-port.name: wireless-controller-port
wireless-controller-port.help: Port used for the control channel in wireless controller mode (wireless-mode is ac). The data channel port is the control channel port number plus one (1024 - 49150, default = 5246).

switch-controller.name: switch-controller
switch-controller.help: Enable/disable switch controller feature. Switch controller allows you to manage FortiSwitch from the FortiGate itself.

switch-controller-reserved-network.name: switch-controller-reserved-network
switch-controller-reserved-network.help: Enable reserved network subnet for controlled switches. This is available when the switch controller is enabled.

scanunit-count.name: scanunit-count
scanunit-count.help: Number of scanunits. The range and the default depend on the number of CPUs. Only available on FortiGate units with multiple CPUs.

proxy-kxp-hardware-acceleration.name: proxy-kxp-hardware-acceleration
proxy-kxp-hardware-acceleration.help: Enable/disable using the content processor to accelerate KXP traffic.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable using the content processor to accelerate KXP traffic.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable using the content processor to accelerate KXP traffic.

proxy-cipher-hardware-acceleration.name: proxy-cipher-hardware-acceleration
proxy-cipher-hardware-acceleration.help: Enable/disable using content processor (CP8 or CP9) hardware acceleration to encrypt and decrypt IPsec and SSL traffic.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable using content processor (CP8 or CP9) hardware acceleration to encrypt and decrypt IPsec and SSL traffic.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable using content processor (CP8 or CP9) hardware acceleration to encrypt and decrypt IPsec and SSL traffic.

fgd-alert-subscription.name: fgd-alert-subscription
fgd-alert-subscription.help: Type of alert to retrieve from FortiGuard.

options.name: advisory
options.help: Retrieve FortiGuard advisories, report and news alerts.

options.name: new-antivirus-db
options.help: Retrieve FortiGuard AV database release alerts.

options.name: new-attack-db
options.help: Retrieve FortiGuard IPS database release alerts.

ipsec-hmac-offload.name: ipsec-hmac-offload
ipsec-hmac-offload.help: Enable/disable offloading (hardware acceleration) of HMAC processing for IPsec VPN.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable offload IPsec HMAC processing to hardware if possible.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable offload IPsec HMAC processing to hardware.

ipv6-accept-dad.name: ipv6-accept-dad
ipv6-accept-dad.help: Enable/disable acceptance of IPv6 Duplicate Address Detection (DAD).

ipv6-allow-anycast-probe.name: ipv6-allow-anycast-probe
ipv6-allow-anycast-probe.help: Enable/disable IPv6 address probe through Anycast.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable probing of IPv6 address space through Anycast

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable probing of IPv6 address space through Anycast

csr-ca-attribute.name: csr-ca-attribute
csr-ca-attribute.help: Enable/disable the CA attribute in certificates. Some CA servers reject CSRs that have the CA attribute.

wimax-4g-usb.name: wimax-4g-usb
wimax-4g-usb.help: Enable/disable comparability with WiMAX 4G USB devices.

cert-chain-max.name: cert-chain-max
cert-chain-max.help: Maximum number of certificates that can be traversed in a certificate chain.

sslvpn-max-worker-count.name: sslvpn-max-worker-count
sslvpn-max-worker-count.help: Maximum number of SSL VPN processes. Upper limit for this value is the number of CPUs and depends on the model.

sslvpn-kxp-hardware-acceleration.name: sslvpn-kxp-hardware-acceleration
sslvpn-kxp-hardware-acceleration.help: Enable/disable SSL VPN KXP hardware acceleration.

sslvpn-plugin-version-check.name: sslvpn-plugin-version-check
sslvpn-plugin-version-check.help: Enable/disable checking browser's plugin version by SSL VPN.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable SSL-VPN automatic checking of browser plug-in version.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable SSL-VPN automatic checking of browser plug-in version.

two-factor-ftk-expiry.name: two-factor-ftk-expiry
two-factor-ftk-expiry.help: FortiToken authentication session timeout (60 - 600 sec (10 minutes), default = 60).

two-factor-email-expiry.name: two-factor-email-expiry
two-factor-email-expiry.help: Email-based two-factor authentication session timeout (30 - 300 seconds (5 minutes), default = 60).

two-factor-sms-expiry.name: two-factor-sms-expiry
two-factor-sms-expiry.help: SMS-based two-factor authentication session timeout (30 - 300 sec, default = 60).

two-factor-fac-expiry.name: two-factor-fac-expiry
two-factor-fac-expiry.help: FortiAuthenticator token authentication session timeout (10 - 3600 seconds (1 hour), default = 60).

two-factor-ftm-expiry.name: two-factor-ftm-expiry
two-factor-ftm-expiry.help: FortiToken Mobile session timeout (1 - 168 hours (7 days), default = 72).

virtual-server-count.name: virtual-server-count
virtual-server-count.help: Maximum number of virtual server processes to create. The maximum is the number of CPU cores. This is not available on single-core CPUs.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable using virtual server hardware acceleration.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable using virtual server hardware acceleration.

wad-worker-count.name: wad-worker-count
wad-worker-count.help: Number of explicit proxy WAN optimization daemon (WAD) processes. By default WAN optimization, explicit proxy, and web caching is handled by all of the CPU cores in a FortiGate unit.

wad-csvc-cs-count.name: wad-csvc-cs-count
wad-csvc-cs-count.help: Number of concurrent WAD-cache-service object-cache processes.

wad-csvc-db-count.name: wad-csvc-db-count
wad-csvc-db-count.help: Number of concurrent WAD-cache-service byte-cache processes.

wad-source-affinity.name: wad-source-affinity
wad-source-affinity.help: Enable/disable dispatching traffic to WAD workers based on source affinity.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable dispatching traffic to WAD workers based on source affinity.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable dispatching traffic to WAD workers based on source affinity.

miglogd-children.name: miglogd-children
miglogd-children.help: Number of logging (miglogd) processes to be allowed to run. Higher number can reduce performance; lower number can slow log processing time. No logs will be dropped or lost if the number is changed.

special-file-23-support.name: special-file-23-support
special-file-23-support.help: Enable/disable IPS detection of HIBUN format files when using Data Leak Protection.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable using IPS detection of HIBUN format files when using Data Leak Protection.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable using IPS detection of HIBUN format files when using Data Leak Protection.

log-uuid.name: log-uuid
log-uuid.help: Whether UUIDs are added to traffic logs. You can disable UUIDs, add firewall policy UUIDs to traffic logs, or add all UUIDs to traffic logs.

options.name: policy-only
options.help: Enable only policy UUID in traffic log.

options.name: extended
options.help: Enable all UUIDs in traffic log.

log-ssl-connection.name: log-ssl-connection
log-ssl-connection.help: Enable/disable logging of SSL connection events.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable logging of SSL connection events.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable logging of SSL connection events.

arp-max-entry.name: arp-max-entry
arp-max-entry.help: Maximum number of dynamically learned MAC addresses that can be added to the ARP table (131072 - 2147483647, default = 131072).

av-affinity.name: av-affinity
av-affinity.help: Affinity setting for AV scanning (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

wad-affinity.name: wad-affinity
wad-affinity.help: Affinity setting for wad (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

ips-affinity.name: ips-affinity
ips-affinity.help: Affinity setting for IPS (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx; allowed CPUs must be less than total number of IPS engine daemons).

miglog-affinity.name: miglog-affinity
miglog-affinity.help: Affinity setting for logging (64-bit hexadecimal value in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

ndp-max-entry.name: ndp-max-entry
ndp-max-entry.help: Maximum number of NDP table entries (set to 65,536 or higher; if set to 0, kernel holds 65,536 entries).

br-fdb-max-entry.name: br-fdb-max-entry
br-fdb-max-entry.help: Maximum number of bridge forwarding database (FDB) entries.

max-route-cache-size.name: max-route-cache-size
max-route-cache-size.help: Maximum number of IP route cache entries (0 - 2147483647).

ipsec-asic-offload.name: ipsec-asic-offload
ipsec-asic-offload.help: Enable/disable ASIC offloading (hardware acceleration) for IPsec VPN traffic. Hardware acceleration can offload IPsec VPN sessions and accelerate encryption and decryption.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable ASIC offload for IPsec VPN.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable ASIC offload for IPsec VPN.

ipsec-soft-dec-async.name: ipsec-soft-dec-async
ipsec-soft-dec-async.help: Enable/disable software decryption asynchronization (using multiple CPUs to do decryption) for IPsec VPN traffic.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable software decryption asynchronization for IPsec VPN.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable software decryption asynchronization for IPsec VPN.

device-idle-timeout.name: device-idle-timeout
device-idle-timeout.help: Time in seconds that a device must be idle to automatically log the device user out. (30 - 31536000 sec (30 sec to 1 year), default = 300).

device-identification-active-scan-delay.name: device-identification-active-scan-delay
device-identification-active-scan-delay.help: Number of seconds to passively scan a device before performing an active scan. (20 - 3600 sec, (20 sec to 1 hour), default = 90).

compliance-check.name: compliance-check
compliance-check.help: Enable/disable global PCI DSS compliance check.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable global PCI DSS compliance check.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable global PCI DSS compliance check.

compliance-check-time.name: compliance-check-time
compliance-check-time.help: Time of day to run scheduled PCI DSS compliance checks.

gui-device-latitude.name: gui-device-latitude
gui-device-latitude.help: Add the latitude of the location of this FortiGate to position it on the Threat Map.

gui-device-longitude.name: gui-device-longitude
gui-device-longitude.help: Add the longitude of the location of this FortiGate to position it on the Threat Map.

private-data-encryption.name: private-data-encryption
private-data-encryption.help: Enable/disable private data encryption using an AES 128-bit key.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable private data encryption using an AES 128-bit key.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable private data encryption using an AES 128-bit key.

auto-auth-extension-device.name: auto-auth-extension-device
auto-auth-extension-device.help: Enable/disable automatic authorization of dedicated Fortinet extension devices.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable automatic authorization of dedicated Fortinet extension device globally.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable automatic authorization of dedicated Fortinet extension device globally.

gui-theme.name: gui-theme
gui-theme.help: Color scheme for the administration GUI.

gui-date-format.name: gui-date-format
gui-date-format.help: Default date format used throughout GUI.

igmp-state-limit.name: igmp-state-limit
igmp-state-limit.help: Maximum number of IGMP memberships (96 - 64000, default = 3200).

vdom.name: vdom
vdom.help: Interface is in this virtual domain (VDOM).

fortilink.name: fortilink
fortilink.help: Enable FortiLink to dedicate this interface to manage other Fortinet devices.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable FortiLink to dedicated interface for managing FortiSwitch devices.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable FortiLink to dedicated interface for managing FortiSwitch devices.

distance.name: distance
distance.help: Distance for routes learned through PPPoE or DHCP, lower distance indicates preferred route.

dhcp-relay-service.name: dhcp-relay-service
dhcp-relay-service.help: Enable/disable allowing this interface to act as a DHCP relay.

management-ip.name: management-ip
management-ip.help: High Availability in-band management IP address of this interface.

ip.name: ip
ip.help: Interface IPv4 address and subnet mask, syntax: X.X.X.X/24.

allowaccess.name: allowaccess
allowaccess.help: Permitted types of management access to this interface.

gwdetect.name: gwdetect
gwdetect.help: Enable/disable detect gateway alive for first.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable detect gateway alive for first.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable detect gateway alive for first.

detectserver.name: detectserver
detectserver.help: Gateway's ping server for this IP.

detectprotocol.name: detectprotocol
detectprotocol.help: Protocols used to detect the server.

ha-priority.name: ha-priority
ha-priority.help: HA election priority for the PING server.

fail-detect.name: fail-detect
fail-detect.help: Enable/disable fail detection features for this interface.

fail-detect-option.name: fail-detect-option
fail-detect-option.help: Options for detecting that this interface has failed.

options.name: detectserver
options.help: Use a ping server to determine if the interface has failed.

options.name: link-down
options.help: Use port detection to determine if the interface has failed.

fail-alert-method.name: fail-alert-method
fail-alert-method.help: Select link-failed-signal or link-down method to alert about a failed link.

fail-action-on-extender.name: fail-action-on-extender
fail-action-on-extender.help: Action on extender when interface fail .

fail-alert-interfaces.name: fail-alert-interfaces
fail-alert-interfaces.help: Names of the FortiGate interfaces from which the link failure alert is sent for this interface.

name.name: name
name.help: Names of the physical interfaces belonging to the aggregate or redundant interface.

dhcp-renew-time.name: dhcp-renew-time
dhcp-renew-time.help: DHCP renew time in seconds (300-604800), 0 means use the renew time provided by the server.

ipunnumbered.name: ipunnumbered
ipunnumbered.help: Unnumbered IP used for PPPoE interfaces for which no unique local address is provided.

username.name: username
username.help: Username of the PPPoE account, provided by your ISP.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable IP address negotiating for unnumbered.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable IP address negotiating for unnumbered.

idle-timeout.name: idle-timeout
idle-timeout.help: PPPoE auto disconnect after idle timeout seconds, 0 means no timeout.

disc-retry-timeout.name: disc-retry-timeout
disc-retry-timeout.help: Time in seconds to wait before retrying to start a PPPoE discovery, 0 means no timeout.

padt-retry-timeout.name: padt-retry-timeout
padt-retry-timeout.help: PPPoE Active Discovery Terminate (PADT) used to terminate sessions after an idle time.

lcp-echo-interval.name: lcp-echo-interval
lcp-echo-interval.help: Time in seconds between PPPoE Link Control Protocol (LCP) echo requests.

lcp-max-echo-fails.name: lcp-max-echo-fails
lcp-max-echo-fails.help: Maximum missed LCP echo messages before disconnect.

defaultgw.name: defaultgw
defaultgw.help: Enable to get the gateway IP from the DHCP or PPPoE server.

dns-server-override.name: dns-server-override
dns-server-override.help: Enable/disable use DNS acquired by DHCP or PPPoE.

options.name: enable
options.help: Use DNS acquired by DHCP or PPPoE.

options.name: disable
options.help: No not use DNS acquired by DHCP or PPPoE.

pptp-timeout.name: pptp-timeout
pptp-timeout.help: Idle timer in minutes (0 for disabled).

options.name: global
options.help: BFD behavior of this interface will be based on global configuration.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable BFD on this interface and ignore global configuration.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable BFD on this interface and ignore global configuration.

vlanforward.name: vlanforward
vlanforward.help: Enable/disable traffic forwarding between VLANs on this interface.

options.name: rpl-bridge-ext-id
options.help: Replace the bridge extension ID only.

ips-sniffer-mode.name: ips-sniffer-mode
ips-sniffer-mode.help: Enable/disable the use of this interface as a one-armed sniffer.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable determining a user's identity from packet identification.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable determining a user's identity from packet identification.

subst.name: subst
subst.help: Enable to always send packets from this interface to a destination MAC address.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not send packets from this interface.

substitute-dst-mac.name: substitute-dst-mac
substitute-dst-mac.help: Destination MAC address that all packets are sent to from this interface.

speed.name: speed
speed.help: Interface speed. The default setting and the options available depend on the interface hardware.

status.name: status
status.help: Bring the interface up or shut the interface down.

options.name: none
options.help: Interface not dedicated for any purpose.

options.name: management
options.help: Dedicate this interface for management purposes only.

trust-ip-1.name: trust-ip-1
trust-ip-1.help: Trusted host for dedicated management traffic (0.0.0.0/24 for all hosts).

trust-ip-2.name: trust-ip-2
trust-ip-2.help: Trusted host for dedicated management traffic (0.0.0.0/24 for all hosts).

trust-ip-3.name: trust-ip-3
trust-ip-3.help: Trusted host for dedicated management traffic (0.0.0.0/24 for all hosts).

trust-ip6-1.name: trust-ip6-1
trust-ip6-1.help: Trusted IPv6 host for dedicated management traffic (::/0 for all hosts).

trust-ip6-2.name: trust-ip6-2
trust-ip6-2.help: Trusted IPv6 host for dedicated management traffic (::/0 for all hosts).

trust-ip6-3.name: trust-ip6-3
trust-ip6-3.help: Trusted IPv6 host for dedicated management traffic (::/0 for all hosts).

mtu-override.name: mtu-override
mtu-override.help: Enable to set a custom MTU for this interface.

wccp.name: wccp
wccp.help: Enable/disable WCCP on this interface. Used for encapsulated WCCP communication between WCCP clients and servers.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable WCCP protocol on this interface.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable WCCP protocol on this interface.

netflow-sampler.name: netflow-sampler
netflow-sampler.help: Enable/disable NetFlow on this interface and set the data that NetFlow collects (rx, tx, or both).

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable NetFlow protocol on this interface.

options.name: tx
options.help: Monitor transmitted traffic on this interface.

options.name: rx
options.help: Monitor received traffic on this interface.

options.name: both
options.help: Monitor transmitted/received traffic on this interface.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable sFlow protocol on this interface.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable sFlow protocol on this interface.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable drop of overlapped fragment packets.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable drop of overlapped fragment packets.

scan-botnet-connections.name: scan-botnet-connections
scan-botnet-connections.help: Enable monitoring or blocking connections to Botnet servers through this interface.

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not scan connections to botnet servers.

sample-direction.name: sample-direction
sample-direction.help: Data that NetFlow collects (rx, tx, or both).

options.name: tx
options.help: Monitor transmitted traffic on this interface.

options.name: rx
options.help: Monitor received traffic on this interface.

options.name: both
options.help: Monitor transmitted/received traffic on this interface.

explicit-web-proxy.name: explicit-web-proxy
explicit-web-proxy.help: Enable/disable the explicit web proxy on this interface.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable explicit Web proxy on this interface.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable explicit Web proxy on this interface.

explicit-ftp-proxy.name: explicit-ftp-proxy
explicit-ftp-proxy.help: Enable/disable the explicit FTP proxy on this interface.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable explicit FTP proxy on this interface.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable explicit FTP proxy on this interface.

proxy-captive-portal.name: proxy-captive-portal
proxy-captive-portal.help: Enable/disable proxy captive portal on this interface.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable proxy captive portal on this interface.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable proxy captive portal on this interface.

tcp-mss.name: tcp-mss
tcp-mss.help: TCP maximum segment size. 0 means do not change segment size.

inbandwidth.name: inbandwidth
inbandwidth.help: Bandwidth limit for incoming traffic (0 - 16776000 kbps), 0 means unlimited.

outbandwidth.name: outbandwidth
outbandwidth.help: Bandwidth limit for outgoing traffic (0 - 16776000 kbps).

disconnect-threshold.name: disconnect-threshold
disconnect-threshold.help: Time in milliseconds to wait before sending a notification that this interface is down or disconnected.

spillover-threshold.name: spillover-threshold
spillover-threshold.help: Egress Spillover threshold (0 - 16776000 kbps), 0 means unlimited.

weight.name: weight
weight.help: Default weight for static routes (if route has no weight configured).

external.name: external
external.help: Enable/disable identifying the interface as an external interface (which usually means it's connected to the Internet).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable identifying the interface as an external interface.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable identifying the interface as an external interface.

member.name: member
member.help: Physical interfaces that belong to the aggregate or redundant interface.

options.name: static
options.help: Use static aggregation, do not send and ignore any LACP messages.

options.name: passive
options.help: Passively use LACP to negotiate 802.3ad aggregation.

options.name: active
options.help: Actively use LACP to negotiate 802.3ad aggregation.

options.name: enable
options.help: Allow HA slave to send/receive LACP messages.

options.name: disable
options.help: Block HA slave from sending/receiving LACP messages.

lacp-speed.name: lacp-speed
lacp-speed.help: How often the interface sends LACP messages.

min-links.name: min-links
min-links.help: Minimum number of aggregated ports that must be up.

min-links-down.name: min-links-down
min-links-down.help: Action to take when less than the configured minimum number of links are active.

link-up-delay.name: link-up-delay
link-up-delay.help: Number of milliseconds to wait before considering a link is up.

priority-override.name: priority-override
priority-override.help: Enable/disable fail back to higher priority port once recovered.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable fail back to higher priority port once recovered.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable fail back to higher priority port once recovered.

managed-device.name: managed-device
managed-device.help: Available when FortiLink is enabled, used for managed devices through FortiLink interface.

alias.name: alias
alias.help: Alias will be displayed with the interface name to make it easier to distinguish.

security-mode.name: security-mode
security-mode.help: Turn on captive portal authentication for this interface.

security-external-web.name: security-external-web
security-external-web.help: URL of external authentication web server.

security-external-logout.name: security-external-logout
security-external-logout.help: URL of external authentication logout server.

security-groups.name: security-groups
security-groups.help: User groups that can authenticate with the captive portal.

name.name: name
name.help: Names of user groups that can authenticate with the captive portal.

device-identification.name: device-identification
device-identification.help: Enable/disable passively gathering of device identity information about the devices on the network connected to this interface.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable passive gathering of identity information about hosts.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable passive gathering of identity information about hosts.

device-user-identification.name: device-user-identification
device-user-identification.help: Enable/disable passive gathering of user identity information about users on this interface.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable passive gathering of user identity information about users.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable passive gathering of user identity information about users.

device-identification-active-scan.name: device-identification-active-scan
device-identification-active-scan.help: Enable/disable active gathering of device identity information about the devices on the network connected to this interface.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable active gathering of identity information about hosts.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable active gathering of identity information about hosts.

device-netscan.name: device-netscan
device-netscan.help: Enable/disable inclusion of devices detected on this interface in network vulnerability scans.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable inclusion of devices detected on this interface in network vulnerability scans.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable inclusion of devices detected on this interface in network vulnerability scans.

lldp-transmission.name: lldp-transmission
lldp-transmission.help: Enable/disable Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) transmission.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable transmission of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP).

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable transmission of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP).

options.name: vdom
options.help: Use VDOM Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) configuration setting.

estimated-upstream-bandwidth.name: estimated-upstream-bandwidth
estimated-upstream-bandwidth.help: Estimated maximum upstream bandwidth (kbps). Used to estimate link utilization.

estimated-downstream-bandwidth.name: estimated-downstream-bandwidth
estimated-downstream-bandwidth.help: Estimated maximum downstream bandwidth (kbps). Used to estimate link utilization.

vrrp-virtual-mac.name: vrrp-virtual-mac

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable use of virtual MAC for VRRP.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable use of virtual MAC for VRRP.

vrip.name: vrip

vrdst.name: vrdst
vrdst.help: Monitor the route to this destination.

vrdst-priority.name: vrdst-priority
vrdst-priority.help: Priority of the virtual router when the virtual router destination becomes unreachable (0 - 254).

ip.help: Set IP addresses of proxy ARP.

options.name: lan
options.help: Connected to local network of endpoints.

snmp-index.name: snmp-index
snmp-index.help: Permanent SNMP Index of the interface.

secondary-IP.name: secondary-IP

ip.name: ip
ip.help: Secondary IP address of the interface.

allowaccess.name: allowaccess
allowaccess.help: Management access settings for the secondary IP address.

gwdetect.name: gwdetect

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable detect gateway alive for first.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable detect gateway alive for first.

detectprotocol.name: detectprotocol
detectprotocol.help: Protocols used to detect the server.

ha-priority.name: ha-priority
ha-priority.help: HA election priority for the PING server.

preserve-session-route.name: preserve-session-route
preserve-session-route.help: Enable/disable preservation of session route when dirty.

options.name: enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable preservation of session route when dirty.

auto-auth-extension-device.name: auto-auth-extension-device

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable automatic authorization of dedicated Fortinet extension device on this interface.

options.name: disable

ap-discover.name: ap-discover

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable automatic registration of unknown FortiAP devices.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable automatic registration of unknown FortiAP devices.

fortilink-stacking.name: fortilink-stacking
fortilink-stacking.help: Enable/disable FortiLink switch-stacking on this interface.

fortilink-split-interface.name: fortilink-split-interface
fortilink-split-interface.help: Enable/disable FortiLink split interface to connect member link to different FortiSwitch in stack for uplink redundancy (maximum 2 interfaces in the "members" command).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable FortiLink split interface to connect member link to different FortiSwitch in stack for uplink redundancy.

options.name: enable
options.help: Block FortiSwitch port-to-port traffic on the VLAN, only permitting traffic to and from the FortiGate.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable DHCP snooping for FortiSwitch devices.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable DHCP snooping for FortiSwitch devices.

switch-controller-dhcp-snooping-verify-m.name: switch-controller-dhcp-snooping-verify-mac
switch-controller-dhcp-snooping-verify-m.help: Switch controller DHCP snooping verify MAC.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable DHCP snooping verify source MAC for FortiSwitch devices.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable DHCP snooping verify source MAC for FortiSwitch devices.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable DHCP snooping insert option82 for FortiSwitch devices.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable DHCP snooping insert option82 for FortiSwitch devices.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable ARP inspection for FortiSwitch devices.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable ARP inspection for FortiSwitch devices.

switch-controller-learning-limit.name: switch-controller-learning-limit
switch-controller-learning-limit.help: Limit the number of dynamic MAC addresses on this VLAN (1 - 128, 0 = no limit, default).

color.name: color
color.help: Color of icon on the GUI.

nd-security-level.name: nd-security-level
nd-security-level.help: Neighbor discovery security level (0 - 7; 0 = least secure, default = 0).

nd-timestamp-delta.name: nd-timestamp-delta
nd-timestamp-delta.help: Neighbor discovery timestamp delta value (1 - 3600 sec; default = 300).

nd-timestamp-fuzz.name: nd-timestamp-fuzz
nd-timestamp-fuzz.help: Neighbor discovery timestamp fuzz factor (1 - 60 sec; default = 1).

ip6-dns-server-override.name: ip6-dns-server-override
ip6-dns-server-override.help: Enable/disable using the DNS server acquired by DHCP.

options.name: enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable using the DNS server acquired by DHCP.

ip6-extra-addr.name: ip6-extra-addr
ip6-extra-addr.help: Extra IPv6 address prefixes of interface.

ip6-allowaccess.name: ip6-allowaccess
ip6-allowaccess.help: Allow management access to the interface.

ip6-send-adv.name: ip6-send-adv
ip6-send-adv.help: Enable/disable sending advertisements about the interface.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable sending advertisements about this interface.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable sending advertisements about this interface.

upstream-interface.name: upstream-interface
upstream-interface.help: Name of the interface that provides delegated information.

subnet.name: subnet
subnet.help: Add subnet ID to routing prefix.

dhcp6-prefix-hint.name: dhcp6-prefix-hint
dhcp6-prefix-hint.help: DHCPv6 prefix that will be used as a hint to the upstream DHCPv6 server.

dhcp6-prefix-hint-plt.name: dhcp6-prefix-hint-plt
dhcp6-prefix-hint-plt.help: DHCPv6 prefix hint preferred life time (sec), 0 means unlimited lease time.

dhcp6-prefix-hint-vlt.name: dhcp6-prefix-hint-vlt
dhcp6-prefix-hint-vlt.help: DHCPv6 prefix hint valid life time (sec).

vrip6_link_local.name: vrip6_link_local
vrip6_link_local.help: Link-local IPv6 address of virtual router.

vrip6.name: vrip6
vrip6.help: IPv6 address of the virtual router.

vrdst6.name: vrdst6
vrdst6.help: Monitor the route to this destination.

group-id.name: group-id
group-id.help: Cluster group ID  (0 - 255). Must be the same for all members.

group-name.name: group-name
group-name.help: Cluster group name. Must be the same for all members.

mode.name: mode
mode.help: HA mode. Must be the same for all members. FGSP requires standalone.

sync-packet-balance.name: sync-packet-balance
sync-packet-balance.help: Enable/disable HA packet distribution to multiple CPUs.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable HA packet distribution to multiple CPUs.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable HA packet distribution to multiple CPUs.

password.name: password
password.help: Cluster password. Must be the same for all members.

hbdev.name: hbdev
hbdev.help: Heartbeat interfaces. Must be the same for all members.

session-sync-dev.name: session-sync-dev
session-sync-dev.help: Offload session sync to one or more interfaces to distribute traffic and prevent delays if needed.

route-ttl.name: route-ttl
route-ttl.help: TTL for primary unit routes (5 - 3600 sec). Increase to maintain active routes during failover.

route-wait.name: route-wait
route-wait.help: Time to wait before sending new routes to the cluster (0 - 3600 sec).

route-hold.name: route-hold
route-hold.help: Time to wait between routing table updates to the cluster (0 - 3600 sec).

multicast-ttl.name: multicast-ttl
multicast-ttl.help: HA multicast TTL on master (5 - 3600 sec).

load-balance-all.name: load-balance-all
load-balance-all.help: Enable to load balance TCP sessions. Disable to load balance proxy sessions only.

hb-interval.name: hb-interval
hb-interval.help: Time between sending heartbeat packets (1 - 20 (100*ms)). Increase to reduce false positives.

hb-lost-threshold.name: hb-lost-threshold
hb-lost-threshold.help: Number of lost heartbeats to signal a failure (1 - 60). Increase to reduce false positives.

hello-holddown.name: hello-holddown
hello-holddown.help: Time to wait before changing from hello to work state (5 - 300 sec).

gratuitous-arps.name: gratuitous-arps
gratuitous-arps.help: Enable/disable gratuitous ARPs. Disable if link-failed-signal enabled.

arps.name: arps
arps.help: Number of gratuitous ARPs (1 - 60). Lower to reduce traffic. Higher to reduce failover time.

arps-interval.name: arps-interval
arps-interval.help: Time between gratuitous ARPs  (1 - 20 sec). Lower to reduce failover time. Higher to reduce traffic.

session-pickup.name: session-pickup
session-pickup.help: Enable/disable session pickup. Enabling it can reduce session down time when fail over happens.

session-pickup-connectionless.name: session-pickup-connectionless
session-pickup-connectionless.help: Enable/disable UDP and ICMP session sync for FGSP.

session-pickup-expectation.name: session-pickup-expectation
session-pickup-expectation.help: Enable/disable session helper expectation session sync for FGSP.

session-pickup-nat.name: session-pickup-nat
session-pickup-nat.help: Enable/disable NAT session sync for FGSP.

session-pickup-delay.name: session-pickup-delay
session-pickup-delay.help: Enable to sync sessions longer than 30 sec. Only longer lived sessions need to be synced.

link-failed-signal.name: link-failed-signal
link-failed-signal.help: Enable to shut down all interfaces for 1 sec after a failover. Use if gratuitous ARPs do not update network.

uninterruptible-upgrade.name: uninterruptible-upgrade
uninterruptible-upgrade.help: Enable to upgrade a cluster without blocking network traffic.

ha-mgmt-status.name: ha-mgmt-status
ha-mgmt-status.help: Enable to reserve interfaces to manage individual cluster units.

ha-mgmt-interfaces.name: ha-mgmt-interfaces
ha-mgmt-interfaces.help: Reserve interfaces to manage individual cluster units.

interface.name: interface
interface.help: Interface to reserve for HA management.

dst.name: dst
dst.help: Default route destination for reserved HA management interface.

gateway.name: gateway
gateway.help: Default route gateway for reserved HA management interface.

gateway6.name: gateway6
gateway6.help: Default IPv6 gateway for reserved HA management interface.

hc-eth-type.name: hc-eth-type
hc-eth-type.help: Transparent mode HA heartbeat packet Ethertype (4-digit hex).

l2ep-eth-type.name: l2ep-eth-type
l2ep-eth-type.help: Telnet session HA heartbeat packet Ethertype (4-digit hex).

ha-uptime-diff-margin.name: ha-uptime-diff-margin
ha-uptime-diff-margin.help: Normally you would only reduce this value for failover testing.

vcluster2.name: vcluster2
vcluster2.help: Enable/disable virtual cluster 2 for virtual clustering.

override.name: override
override.help: Enable and increase the priority of the unit that should always be primary (master).

priority.name: priority
priority.help: Increase the priority to select the primary unit (0 - 255).

override-wait-time.name: override-wait-time
override-wait-time.help: Delay negotiating if override is enabled (0 - 3600 sec). Reduces how often the cluster negotiates.

schedule.name: schedule
schedule.help: Type of A-A load balancing. Use none if you have external load balancers.

weight.name: weight
weight.help: Weight-round-robin weight for each cluster unit. Syntax <priority> <weight>.

cpu-threshold.name: cpu-threshold
cpu-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing CPU usage weight and high and low thresholds.

memory-threshold.name: memory-threshold
memory-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing memory usage weight and high and low thresholds.

http-proxy-threshold.name: http-proxy-threshold
http-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of HTTP proxy sessions.

ftp-proxy-threshold.name: ftp-proxy-threshold
ftp-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of FTP proxy sessions.

imap-proxy-threshold.name: imap-proxy-threshold
imap-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of IMAP proxy sessions.

nntp-proxy-threshold.name: nntp-proxy-threshold
nntp-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of NNTP proxy sessions.

pop3-proxy-threshold.name: pop3-proxy-threshold
pop3-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of POP3 proxy sessions.

smtp-proxy-threshold.name: smtp-proxy-threshold
smtp-proxy-threshold.help: Dynamic weighted load balancing weight and high and low number of SMTP proxy sessions.

monitor.name: monitor
monitor.help: Interfaces to check for port monitoring (or link failure).

pingserver-monitor-interface.name: pingserver-monitor-interface
pingserver-monitor-interface.help: Interfaces to check for remote IP monitoring.

pingserver-slave-force-reset.name: pingserver-slave-force-reset
pingserver-slave-force-reset.help: Enable to force the cluster to negotiate after a remote IP monitoring failover.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable force reset of slave after PING server failure.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable force reset of slave after PING server failure.

pingserver-flip-timeout.name: pingserver-flip-timeout
pingserver-flip-timeout.help: Time to wait in minutes before renegotiating after a remote IP monitoring failover.

override.name: override
override.help: Enable and increase the priority of the unit that should always be primary (master).

priority.name: priority
priority.help: Increase the priority to select the primary unit (0 - 255).

override-wait-time.name: override-wait-time
override-wait-time.help: Delay negotiating if override is enabled (0 - 3600 sec). Reduces how often the cluster negotiates.

monitor.name: monitor
monitor.help: Interfaces to check for port monitoring (or link failure).

pingserver-monitor-interface.name: pingserver-monitor-interface
pingserver-monitor-interface.help: Interfaces to check for remote IP monitoring.

pingserver-slave-force-reset.name: pingserver-slave-force-reset
pingserver-slave-force-reset.help: Enable to force the cluster to negotiate after a remote IP monitoring failover.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable force reset of slave after PING server failure.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable force reset of slave after PING server failure.

ha-direct.name: ha-direct
ha-direct.help: Enable/disable using ha-mgmt interface for syslog, SNMP, remote authentication (RADIUS), FortiAnalyzer, FortiManager and FortiSandbox.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable using ha-mgmt interface for syslog, SNMP, remote authentication (RADIUS), FortiAnalyzer, FortiManager and FortiSandbox.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable using ha-mgmt interface for syslog, SNMP, remote authentication (RADIUS), FortiAnalyzer, FortiManager and FortiSandbox.

inter-cluster-session-sync.name: inter-cluster-session-sync
inter-cluster-session-sync.help: Enable/disable synchronization of sessions among HA clusters.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable synchronization of sessions among HA clusters.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable synchronization of sessions among HA clusters.

dst.name: dst
dst.help: Destination IP and mask for this route.

dynamic-gateway.name: dynamic-gateway
dynamic-gateway.help: Enable use of dynamic gateway retrieved from a DHCP or PPP server.

dstaddr.name: dstaddr
dstaddr.help: Name of firewall address or address group.

internet-service.name: internet-service
internet-service.help: Application ID in the Internet service database.

internet-service-custom.name: internet-service-custom
internet-service-custom.help: Application name in the Internet service custom database.

link-monitor-exempt.name: link-monitor-exempt
link-monitor-exempt.help: Enable/disable withdrawing this route when link monitor or health check is down.
